description: This module introduces the students to the basics of financial mathematics and targets all students who have an interest in building a foundation in financial mathematics. Topics include basic mathematical theory of interest, term structure of interest rates, fixed income securities, risk aversion, basic utility theory, single-period portfolio optimization, basic option theory. Mathematical rigor will be emphasized.
title: Mathematical Finance I
prerequisite: (CS1010 or CS1010E or CS1010S or CS1010FC or IT1006 or CS1101 or CS1101C or CS1101S or IT1002) and (ST2131 or ST2334 or MA2216)
